definition: private room (in a restaurant, bath house, etc)
elegant
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: Would you prefer a table in a private room or in the main dining hall?
sentences.chinese: 你们要一个雅间还是在大厅就座？

sentences.english: One of the larger rooms even houses a piano.
sentences.chinese: 在一个大一些的雅间内甚至还放着一部钢琴。

sentences.english: Private rooms are available.Do you want one?
sentences.chinese: 雅间可以的，您要一间吗？

sentences.english: Seven thirty. Would you please set us in a private room?
sentences.chinese: 七点半。能给我们安排雅间吗？

sentences.english: I am very sorry. There is only one table for four left in the hall. Is a private room all right?
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，大厅里只有四人座的桌子了，雅间可以吗？

definition: private room (in a restaurant, or for karaoke etc)/parlor/booth/compartment
(restaurant etc) private room/booth/comfortable seating
compartment (of train, ship etc)/private room at restaurant/rented room for karaoke/hotel room rented by the hour
box (in a theater or concert hall)/private room (in a restaurant or karaoke)
restaurant
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
wing (of a traditional house)/side room
tearoom/teahouse/dimsum restaurant (Hong Kong)
single seat (in theater)/irregular passenger (in rickshaw)
food and drink/food to accompany wine
dining room/dining hall/mess hall
(Tw) apartment (with shared bathroom and kitchen)/bedsit
wine shop/liquor store/bottle shop/bar/pub
warm room/warm partition of a room
hall
